Module org.example.eiscuno
Package org.example.eiscuno.model.game

Class GameUno

java.lang.Object
org.example.eiscuno.model.game.GameUnoAdapter
org.example.eiscuno.model.game.GameUno
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, IGameUno
public class GameUno extends GameUnoAdapter implements Serializable
Represents a full game of Uno, extending the base logic provided by GameUnoAdapter.

This class serves as the main implementation of a UNO game, connecting all necessary components such as the human player, machine player, deck, and table.

Unlike GameUnoAdapter, this class does not override any behavior yet, but provides a dedicated instantiable implementation for the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameUno

      public GameUno(Player humanPlayer, Player machinePlayer, Deck deck, Table table)
      Constructs a new GameUno instance by initializing both players, the deck, and the table where the game will take place.

      This constructor delegates initialization of core logic to the parent GameUnoAdapter constructor.

      Parameters:
      humanPlayer - the Player controlled by a human participant
      machinePlayer - the Player controlled by the AI opponent
      deck - the Deck containing the cards for this game
      table - the Table on which cards will be played
